# OctoAcme Onboarding Checklist

> **Purpose:** Ensure new team members are systematically onboarded with access to tools, documentation, and team introductions. This checklist addresses gaps identified in [Issue #4](https://github.com/GijsL/skills-scale-institutional-knowledge-using-copilot-spaces/issues/4) regarding incomplete onboarding steps.

---

## New Team Member Information

| Field | Value |
|-------|-------|
| Name | |
| Role | |
| Start Date | |
| Manager | |
| Onboarding Buddy | |

---

## Day 1: Essentials

### Access & Accounts
- [ ] GitHub organization access granted
- [ ] Added to relevant repositories
- [ ] Slack/Teams workspace access
- [ ] Email and calendar set up
- [ ] Project management tool access (GitHub Projects, Jira, etc.)

### Documentation
- [ ] Read [Project Management Overview](../octoacme-project-management-overview.md)
- [ ] Read [Roles and Personas](../octoacme-roles-and-personas.md) (find your role)
- [ ] Review team README and contribution guidelines

### Introductions
- [ ] Meet with manager for role expectations
- [ ] Introduce to onboarding buddy
- [ ] Team introduction (standup or async)

---

## Week 1: Foundation

### Role-Specific Onboarding

#### For Developers
- [ ] Development environment setup guide completed
- [ ] Repository structure walkthrough
- [ ] CI/CD pipeline overview with DevOps Engineer
- [ ] First PR submitted (documentation fix or small task)
- [ ] Code review guidelines reviewed

#### For Product Managers (PdM)
- [ ] Product roadmap walkthrough
- [ ] Backlog and prioritization process overview
- [ ] Meet with key stakeholders
- [ ] Review recent feature specs and one-pagers

#### For Project Managers (PM)
- [ ] Project board and workflow orientation
- [ ] Risk register and communication templates reviewed
- [ ] Meeting cadence and facilitation guidelines
- [ ] Review [Risks and Communication](../octoacme-risks-and-communication.md)

#### For QA/Testers
- [ ] Test environment access and setup
- [ ] Test plan templates and conventions
- [ ] CI/CD test integration overview
- [ ] Review Definition of Done criteria

#### For UX/UI Designers
- [ ] Design system and style guide access
- [ ] Design tools setup (Figma, Sketch, etc.)
- [ ] Review recent design decisions and rationale
- [ ] Meet with PdM to understand product vision

#### For Security Engineers
- [ ] Security scanning tools overview
- [ ] Review security incident runbook
- [ ] Infrastructure security documentation
- [ ] Meet with DevOps on security integration

#### For DevOps / Release Engineers
- [ ] CI/CD pipeline architecture walkthrough
- [ ] Infrastructure documentation access
- [ ] Review [Release and Deployment Guide](../octoacme-release-and-deployment.md)
- [ ] On-call and incident response procedures

#### For Customer Support
- [ ] Support ticketing system access
- [ ] Knowledge base and FAQ access
- [ ] Escalation paths documented
- [ ] Meet with PdM for product context

#### For Business Analysts
- [ ] Requirements documentation templates
- [ ] Process mapping tools access
- [ ] Stakeholder list and communication channels
- [ ] Review recent requirements documents

### Process Understanding
- [ ] Attend first team standup
- [ ] Review [Execution and Tracking](../octoacme-execution-and-tracking.md)
- [ ] Understand escalation paths (team → PM → Product Lead → Sponsor)

---

## Week 2-4: Integration

### Participation
- [ ] Attend sprint planning meeting
- [ ] Participate in at least one demo/review
- [ ] Shadow experienced team member on key task
- [ ] Complete first meaningful contribution to project

### Knowledge Building
- [ ] Review [Project Planning](../octoacme-project-planning.md)
- [ ] Review [Project Initiation](../octoacme-project-initiation.md)
- [ ] Understand Definition of Done for current project
- [ ] Review Risk Register and add any identified risks

### Feedback
- [ ] Week 2 check-in with manager
- [ ] Week 4 check-in with manager
- [ ] Provide feedback on onboarding experience

---

## 30-Day Check-In

### Assessment
- [ ] Role expectations clear?
- [ ] Access to all required tools?
- [ ] Integrated into team communication?
- [ ] First contributions completed?
